com.tradewright.tradebuild.tickutils
Interface TickDataEncoder

public interface TickDataEncoder

This interface is implemented by classes that provide the ability to encode tick data into encoded segments.

Method Summary

          Encodes an ask tick.

encodeMarketDepthData

void encodeMarketDepthData(java.util.Date timestamp,
                           int position,
                           java.lang.String marketmaker,
                           int operation,
                           int side,
                           double price,
                           int size)
Encodes a market depth tick.

Parameters:
timestamp - The tick's timestamp.
position - The position in the Depth-of-Market table.
marketmaker - The market maker's identifier.
operation - The operation to be performed in the Depth-of-Market table.
side - The side of the Depth-of-Market table affected.
price - The tick price.
size - The tick size.

getBasePrice

double getBasePrice()
Returns the first price recorded in the data encoded by this encoder. This value must be stored by the application in addition to the encoded data itself, because it has to be passed to the decoder to enable the data to be correctly decoded.

Returns:
The first price recorded in the data encoded by this encoder.

getEncodedData

byte[] getEncodedData()
Returns the encoded data generated by this encoder.

Returns:
The encoded data generated by this encoder.

getEncodedDataLength

int getEncodedDataLength()
Returns the length in bytes of the encoded data generated by this encoder.

Returns:
The length in bytes of the encoded data generated by this encoder.

getEncodingFormatIdentifier

java.lang.String getEncodingFormatIdentifier()
Returns a URN uniquely identifying the format of the encoded data. This value must be stored by the application in addition to the encoded data itself, because it has to be passed to the decoder to enable the data to be correctly decoded. Due to the length of this identifier, it may be desirable to design the application such that this value is not repeated for every stored segment of encoded data. This design may need to allow for individual segments to be updated in the future by a later version of the encoding that uses a different format and hence supplies a different identifier.

Returns:
A URN uniquely identifying the format of the encoded data.

getPeriodStartTime

java.util.Date getPeriodStartTime()
Returns the period start time supplied when instantiating this decoder using getTickEncoder.

Returns:
The period start time supplied when instantiating this decoder.

getTickSize

double getTickSize()
Returns the minimum tick size supplied when instantiating this decoder using getTickEncoder.

Returns:
The minimum tick size for this encoder.
